Package org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.opt

Class EfficientFairSimulation

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.opt.EfficientFairSimulation
public class EfficientFairSimulation
extends java.lang.Object
This class provides a much more efficient computation of fair simulation compared to FairSimulation. Instead of Game used in FairSimulation, this class uses a simpler structure SimpleParityGame.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

  • Constructor Details

    • EfficientFairSimulation

      public EfficientFairSimulation()

  • Method Details

    • getFairSimulationGame

      public SimpleParityGame getFairSimulationGame​(FSA aut, java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​Pair<State,​State>> map)
      Returns a simple parity game used to compute the fair simulation relation of a Büchi automaton.
      Parameters:
      aut - a Büchi automaton
      map - a map for storing the mapping from a state s of the returned simple parity game to a pair of a state s1 in aut and a state s2 in aut which determines s1 is fairly simulated by s2 if s is in the winning region of GamePlayer.P0
      Returns:
      a simple parity game used to compute the fair simulation relation of the Büchi automata
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if aut is not a Büchi automaton

    • getFairSimulationGame

      public SimpleParityGame getFairSimulationGame​(FSA aut, TrinaryMap<State,​State,​java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> map0, BinaryMap<State,​State,​java.lang.Integer> map1, java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​Pair<State,​State>> map)
      Returns a simple parity game used to compute the fair simulation relation of a Büchi automaton.
      Parameters:
      aut - a Büchi automaton
      map0 - a map for storing the mapping from a state in the automaton, another state in the automaton, and a symbol to a game state of GamePlayer.P0
      map1 - a map for storing the mapping from a state in the automaton and another state in the automaton to a game state of GamePlayer.P1
      map - a map for storing the mapping from a state s of the returned simple parity game to a pair of a state s1 in aut and a state s2 in aut which determines s1 is fairly simulated by s2 if s is in the winning region of GamePlayer.P0
      Returns:
      a simple parity game used to compute the fair simulation relation of the Büchi automata
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if aut is not a Büchi automaton

    • getFairSimulationGame

      public SimpleParityGame getFairSimulationGame​(FSA aut1, FSA aut2, java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​Pair<State,​State>> map)
      Returns a simple parity game used to compute the fair simulation relation of two Büchi automata.
      Parameters:
      aut1 - a Büchi automaton
      aut2 - a Büchi automaton
      map - a map for storing the mapping from a state s of the returned simple parity game to a pair of a state s1 in aut1 and a state s2 in aut2 which determines s1 is fairly simulated by s2 if s is in the winning region of GamePlayer.P0
      Returns:
      a simple parity game used to compute the fair simulation relation of the Büchi automata
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if aut1 or aut2 is not a Büchi automaton, the automata have different alphabet type, or the automata have different label position

    • getFairSimulationGame

      public SimpleParityGame getFairSimulationGame​(FSA aut1, FSA aut2, TrinaryMap<State,​State,​java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> map0, BinaryMap<State,​State,​java.lang.Integer> map1, java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​Pair<State,​State>> map)
      Returns a simple parity game used to compute the fair simulation relation of two Büchi automata.
      Parameters:
      aut1 - a Büchi automaton
      aut2 - a Büchi automaton
      map0 - a map for storing the mapping from a state in the first automaton, a state in the second automaton, and a symbol to a game state of GamePlayer.P0
      map1 - a map for storing the mapping from a state in the first automaton and a state in the second automaton to a game state of GamePlayer.P1
      map - a map for storing the mapping from a state s of the returned simple parity game to a pair of a state s1 in the first automaton and a state s2 in the second automaton which determines s1 is fairly simulated by s2 if s is in the winning region of GamePlayer.P0
      Returns:
      a simple parity game used to compute the fair simulation relation of the Büchi automata
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if aut1 or aut2 is not a Büchi automaton, the automata have different alphabet type, or the automata have different label position

    • getFairSimulationRelation

      public Relation<State> getFairSimulationRelation​(FSA aut)
      Returns the fair simulation relation of a Büchi automaton. If (s1, s2) is in the returned relation, then s1 is fairly simulated by s2.
      Parameters:
      aut - a Büchi automaton
      Returns:
      the fair simulation relation of the Büchi automaton
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if aut is not a Büchi automaton

    • getFairSimulationRelation

      public Relation<State> getFairSimulationRelation​(FSA aut1, FSA aut2)
      Returns the fair simulation relation of two Büchi automata. If (s1, s2) is in the returned relation, then s1 in the first automaton is fairly simulated by s2 in the second automaton.
      Parameters:
      aut1 - a Büchi automaton
      aut2 - a Büchi automaton
      Returns:
      the fair simulation relation of the Büchi automata
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if aut1 or aut2 is not a Büchi automaton, the automata have different alphabet type, or the automata have different label position

    • isFairlySimulated

      public boolean isFairlySimulated​(FSA aut1, FSA aut2)
      Returns true if the first specified Büchi automaton is fairly simulated by the second specified Büchi automaton.
      Parameters:
      aut1 - a Büchi automaton
      aut2 - a Büchi automaton
      Returns:
      true if aut1 is fairly simulated by aut2
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if aut1 or aut2 is not a Büchi automaton, the automata have different alphabet type, or the automata have different label position
